item.description:
A true gem of the NEK and VT in general, Lake Willoughby is known as VT's fjord because of the towering cliffs on the east and west bank (Mts. Pisgah and Hor, respectively). The cliffs drop sharply to water that reaches 308 feet deep, making Willoughby VT's deepest lake.

Mt. Pisgah is a challenging hike! But once at the top, the views are astounding. I have hiked in and out via the North Trail, but if we have more than one car we can park one at the north head and one at the south and walk the whole trail (see the map on the link).

Here is one hiker's description with a map: http://www.hikenewengland.com/Pisgah040605.html

Â

group.name: Lebanon/White River Junction Hiking Meetup Group

item.name: Hike Mt. Pisgah (Lake Willoughby)
